intro: Barleria calophylloides subsp. calophylloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense spikes at the ends of the stems. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
